thread.title: 'We believe in London': US venture capitalists shrug off tax rises
thread.title_full: 'We believe in London': US venture capitalists shrug off tax rises

author: Hannah Prevett
title: 'We believe in London': US venture capitalists shrug off tax rises
text:
It was a dream realised for Sarah Sclarsic and Sierra Peterson, two former Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, when they opened a London outpost of their venture capital firm in October.
However, no sooner had they set up shop when the chancellor Rachel Reeves delivered her maiden budget announcing measures that entrepreneurs complained risked damaging the UK’s competitiveness on the world stage.
They included increasing capital gains tax (CGT) at the lower rate from 10 per cent to 18 per cent and from 20 per cent to 24 per cent at the higher rate. There were also changes to [business asset disposal relief](https://www.thetimes.com/article/can-i-offset-share-losses-against-cgt-when-i-sell-my-holiday-let-rkds6pwhg), also known as entrepreneurs’ relief, making it less generous, as well as an increase on CGT paid by institutional investors on “carried interest”,
